project.name: KEIKI Replatform Off Mainframe (KROM) Project
project.description: Replatform the KEIKI System and provide ongoing operations support.

issues.description: Project managers started meeting regularly to review the project schedule.
issues.remedy: Recalibrate the project schedule in May.
issues.title: Project Schedule Recalibration

issues.description: CSEA did not start reporting on success metrics in April as planned.
issues.remedy: Start reporting on success metrics to improve benefits realization.
issues.title: Delayed Success Metrics Reporting

issues.description: Zero float between D-21 approval and Acceptance Testing start.
issues.remedy: Schedule adjustments and risk mitigation in May.
issues.title: Approval and Testing Overlap

issues.description: Task 546 (Batch Finalization) remains 0% complete.
issues.remedy: Focus on prioritizing batch finalization.
issues.title: Batch Finalization Delay

issues.description: Deliverable D-21 (System Test Results Report) is only 25% complete.
issues.remedy: Complete supporting documentation and traceability.
issues.title: Incomplete System Test Report

issues.description: There are 2 blockers to the final decision on test data delivery; date/time issue and packed binary fields.
issues.remedy: Key decision on selection of the method for performing data extracts is pending.
issues.title: Test Data Delivery Blockers

issues.description: The data extraction process is facing delays due to shared mainframe resources, inefficiencies, and lengthy download/upload times.
issues.remedy: CSEA is currently evaluating a SQL replication strategy, involving two dedicated resources and daily meetings to address these issues.
issues.title: Data Extraction Process Delays

issues.description: A critical defect in NSDDC01J batch job execution is affecting the Precisely API allocation.
issues.remedy: A support ticket was opened in late August to address this with Precisely.
issues.title: NSDDC01J Batch Job Defect

issues.description: SIT is still ongoing at 82% completion with UAT progress at 2.45%.
issues.remedy: Continue testing and resolve remaining test scripts.
issues.title: Testing Progress and Completion

issues.description: The payment schedule although agreed upon verbally, has not been formally accepted.
issues.remedy: Formal acceptance is expected to be concluded in September through a separate change request.
issues.title: Verbal Payment Schedule Discrepancy

issues.description: The project schedule does not adequately identify all CSEA tasks and individual resource responsibilities.
issues.remedy: Assess the need for additional project support for Protech’s Manager.
issues.title: Incomplete Task Identification

issues.description: Resources are overallocated, and tasks continue to be shifted or added impacting project resources.
issues.remedy: Revisit project plans and activities to determine appropriate communications and engagement.
issues.title: Resource Overallocation Management

issues.description: Testing Progress: Batch testing reached 31%, and FTD execution improved to 35%, but unresolved defects still block 92% of cases, delaying critical test readiness.
issues.remedy: Resolve defects to unblock cases and ensure test readiness.
issues.title: Unresolved Defects Blocking Testing

issues.description: Data Validation: SQL-to-SQL validation and field alignment issues progressed, but persistent interface data discrepancies and mainframe inefficiencies risk cutover delays.
issues.remedy: Address data discrepancies and improve mainframe efficiencies.
issues.title: Data Validation Discrepancies

issues.description: Schedule Slippage: The KMS Go-Live date reported in the KEIKI Project Schedule 121824 slipped by 22 days (to October 14, 2025), with further delays possible if dependencies are not resolved.
issues.remedy: Resolve dependencies to prevent further schedule slippage.
issues.title: KMS Go-Live Date Delay

issues.description: Interface Integration: Weekly workshops advanced interface testing, but modernization efforts are creating delays due to impact timelines.
issues.remedy: Align modernization efforts with interface testing timelines.
issues.title: Interface Modernization Delays

issues.description: Resource Constraints: Mainframe adjustments improving efficiency, but skilled resource shortages for existing areas remain a barrier.
issues.remedy: Address skilled resource shortages to improve efficiency.
issues.title: Skilled Resource Shortage Barrier

issues.description: Project delays have stabilized but are still showing a 17-day project delay.
issues.remedy: Project Managers should assess the impact of delays and collaborate on ways to get the project timeline back on track.
issues.title: Project Timeline Delays

issues.description: The one-month delayed KEIKI scope validation impacted the timeliness of data extraction testing, requirements documentation, data conversion, refactored application delivery, and user interface refinement.
issues.remedy: There needs to be a clearer mutual understanding of how Protech’s development and testing approach will ensure that the new system and user interface will maintain the same functionality as the old system.
issues.title: Delayed Scope Validation Impact

issues.description: Batch job validation efforts remain at 38%, impacted by SQL replication failures and data extraction inefficiencies.
issues.remedy: Optimize extraction schedules, implement automated validation scripts, and align cross-agency testing efforts to improve accuracy and efficiency.
issues.title: Batch Job Validation Challenges

issues.description: The deliverable Knowledge Transfer Plan-Draft v0.1 dated 2/7/2025 has not been completed as of 2/28/2025.
issues.remedy: Implement structured knowledge transfer sessions to ensure full alignment on testing methodologies, defect triage, and execution strategies while setting schedule expectations with the test team.
issues.title: Incomplete Knowledge Transfer Plan

issues.description: Ineffective project status meetings and reports can lead to delayed decision-making, lack of accountability, and reduced morale.
issues.remedy: CSEA should play an active role in refining the project status report and providing topics for weekly project meetings.
issues.title: Improving Project Status Communication

issues.description: Testing Progress: Included advancements in system integration testing, defect resolution efforts addressing key functionality gaps, and increased validation coverage for financials and batch processes, though challenges remain with data inconsistencies, prolonged batch job execution times, and dependencies on unresolved interface issues.
issues.remedy: Continue defect resolution and increase validation coverage.
issues.title: System Testing and Validation Challenges

issues.description: Data Validation: Incremental improvements through SQL-to-SQL comparisons and refined extraction processes, but persistent discrepancies in interface data, batch outputs, and file formatting continue to pose challenges, requiring further verification and correction efforts.
issues.remedy: Further verification and correction efforts.
issues.title: Persistent Data Discrepancies

issues.description: Schedule Slippage: The schedule slippage is currently being driven by batch job execution, ongoing data validation challenges, and dependencies on external modernization projects, with critical tasks remaining undefined, as the project team actively working on mitigation strategies to ensure alignment with key milestones.
issues.remedy: Mitigation strategies to ensure alignment with key milestones.
issues.title: Schedule Slippage Mitigation Strategies

issues.description: The data extraction process is facing delays due to shared mainframe resources, inefficiencies, and lengthy download/upload times.
issues.remedy: CSEA is currently evaluating a SQL replication strategy, involving two dedicated resources and daily meetings to address these issues.
issues.title: Data Extraction Delays Solution

issues.description: The selection of the method for performing data extracts is scheduled for the first week of August. The preferred method of SQL to SQL is currently not meeting customer expectations.
issues.remedy: CSEA and Protech continue to work together to refine the data extraction process, enhancing the effectiveness of data validation.
issues.title: SQL Data Extraction Improvement

issues.description: 80-day schedule variance affecting critical path.
issues.remedy: Escalation and leadership involvement required.
issues.title: Critical Path Schedule Delay

issues.description: Continued system testing delays due to unresolved defects.
issues.remedy: Address defects and untested batch jobs.
issues.title: System Testing Delay Resolution

issues.description: Differences between ADABAS and SQL (KROM) record counts.
issues.remedy: Resolve discrepancies.
issues.title: ADABAS vs SQL Record Discrepancies

issues.description: Critical defect in NSDDC01J batch job execution affecting Precisely API allocation.
issues.remedy: Testing limited to 10 records.
issues.title: NSDDC01J Batch Job Defect

issues.description: Data extraction process is facing delays due to shared mainframe resources, inefficiencies, and lengthy download/upload times.
issues.remedy: CSEA is evaluating a SQL replication strategy, involving two dedicated resources and daily meetings to address these issues, with the goal of completing validation by July 31st.
issues.title: Data Extraction Delays Solution

issues.description: The project faces a significant risk of incurring extensive costs for delivering the necessary data to test the refactored KEIKI application.
issues.remedy: Continue negotiations with ETS to secure financial support for data delivery. Explore alternative solutions with Protech and AWS. Improve performance of data extraction programs.
issues.title: High Data Delivery Costs Risk

issues.description: A new observation was opened this month regarding the classification of defects.
issues.remedy: A meeting was held to discuss and align.
issues.title: Defect Classification Alignment

issues.description: The current payment process is based on prorated payments to ProTech on an outdated schedule.
issues.remedy: Rebaselining is highly recommended to update the project schedule.
issues.title: Outdated Payment Schedule

issues.description: The timing of multiple agencies moving off the mainframe at different times will result in the need to modify KEIKI system interfaces after the system has been deployed.
issues.remedy: CSEA should coordinate regular meetings with impacted State of Hawaii agencies. Roles, responsibilities, expectations and interface requirements should be clearly defined to ensure information and project status is proactively communicated for the various modernization efforts.
issues.title: Mainframe Transition Coordination

issues.description: Inadequate schedule and resource management practices may lead to project delays, missed project activities, unrealistic schedule forecasts, or unidentified causes for delays.
issues.remedy: Based on the complexity of the KEIKI project, review and refine the schedule regularly with detailed tasks, realistic durations, and adequate resources.
issues.title: Inadequate Project Schedule Management

issues.description: Testing Transition & Execution Risks
issues.remedy: Refinement needed for Knowledge Transfer Plan and alignment on testing methodologies.
issues.title: Testing Transition Risk Alignment

issues.description: Data Extraction & Validation Inefficiencies
issues.remedy: Continue focus on implementing automated validation scripts and refining extract delivery cadence.
issues.title: Automated Data Validation Enhancement

issues.description: System Performance and Stability
issues.remedy: Batch job execution times improved with hardware upgrades and optimizations.
issues.title: Enhanced Batch Job Efficiency

issues.description: Security & Compliance
issues.remedy: Implement data masking protocols and controlled testing environments.
issues.title: Data Security Enhancement Measures

issues.description: Project schedule variance of 17 days.
issues.remedy: Establish a process to review payment schedules for changes in deliverable timelines.
issues.title: Project Schedule Variance Management

issues.description: 80% of test scripts passed showing incremental improvements.
issues.remedy: Start more robust reporting on test and defect metrics when system testing begins.
issues.title: Enhance Test Reporting Metrics

issues.description: Batch job performance testing and data extract discrepancies.
issues.remedy: Iterative retesting cycles.
issues.title: Batch Job Testing Discrepancies

issues.description: Critical system testing defects remain unresolved.
issues.remedy: Focused retesting cycles.
issues.title: Unresolved Testing Defects

issues.description: Absence of an approved, updated project schedule.
issues.remedy: Formal schedule realignment.
issues.title: Project Schedule Realignment

issues.description: Temporary leave of absence of the CSEA Project Manager.
issues.remedy: Interim coverage by CSEA leadership.
issues.title: Project Management Interim Coverage

issues.description: Untimely project management responsibilities may impact effective project execution.
issues.remedy: Improve the project schedule to address schedule comments. Develop a detailed plan with assigned resources to complete project tasks.
issues.title: Project Schedule Optimization

issues.description: Complex data system migration requirements, combined with incomplete documentation and the absence of a formalized process for non-code tasks, may lead to project delays, unmet contract requirements, and quality issues.
issues.remedy: Develop separate formalized data system migration plans and processes for non-code elements.
issues.title: Data Migration Process Gaps

issues.description: Risks associated with long batch runtimes, data discrepancies, and interface dependencies.
issues.remedy: Closely monitor and address risks to maintain Go-Live timeline.
issues.title: Batch Runtime and Data Risks

issues.description: Untimely project management responsibilities may impact effective project execution.
issues.remedy: CSEA and Protech’s Project Manager are working closely to define deliverables and develop a realistic and achievable timeline.
issues.title: Project Management Timeliness

issues.description: Data Integrity: Occasional low values and data inconsistencies.
issues.remedy: Continued focus from CSEA to ensure data accuracy and support testing efforts effectively.
issues.title: Data Integrity Inconsistencies

issues.description: Interface testing data completeness from external partners has been inconsistent.
issues.remedy: Continued collaboration to improve data availability and support smoother testing cycles.
issues.title: Inconsistent Data from Partners

issues.description: There is one blocker remaining to the final decision on test data delivery, date/time issue.
issues.remedy: The key decision on selection of the method for performing data extracts is pending.
issues.title: Test Data Delivery Blocker

issues.description: System Integration Testing is still ongoing at 93% completion.
issues.remedy: Continue testing and address remaining defects.
issues.title: System Testing Progress Update

issues.description: UAT script failure rate is approximately 40%.
issues.remedy: Improve UAT execution and defect resolution.
issues.title: High UAT Script Failure Rate

issues.description: Deliverable #9, the Disaster Recovery Plan, has not been received by CSEA.
issues.remedy: Ensure delivery and approval of the Disaster Recovery Plan.
issues.title: Disaster Recovery Plan Delay

events.description: The KEIKI system data was extracted and loaded into the SQL database.

events.description: Protech will present their testing approach in May.

events.description: Completed with 119 test scripts executed and a 100% pass rate.

events.description: Reached 74% completion.

events.name: Go-Live Playbook Execution
events.description: Scheduled for October 31.

events.description: Delivered on 8/22/24. Deployment was completed on 8/23/24.

events.description: Delivered on 8/28/24.

events.description: Resource shortages and unresolved dependencies such as interface discrepancies.

events.description: The KEIKI application assessment validation was completed in February; however, this 1-month delay impacted the timeliness of data extraction programming and testing.
